reviews.review: You did a pretty good job so far :D!
es un juego bastante entretenido pero con mucho camper :P

Developers only care about the player that primarily play as the killer, and that is because most, if not all of the developers play primarily killer.  The level of dishonest BS that come out of the two developers mouths during there weekly stream on Twitch.  The match making is a joke in this game.  The excuse for this is "oh it's just rank reset." The community is toxic if you express an opinion they don't like (as if the gaming community as a whole doesn't have a bad reputation for being toxic[thanks gamer gate]).  They need remember that people on both sides (killer main or survivor main) bought and played this game. They need to be fair to both sides.  And I don't even want to hear "well it's 4v1, so they need be given more" or this survivor perk is OP."  Don't get me start on everything that killers get to get kills.

Worst patch so far, avoid playing till they fix everything... 

Absolutely dogshit UI in this patch, devs were told it was bad by streamers and the community and put it in anyway, despite it inducing motion sickness at times cause of how spread out everything is for NO reason. BRING BACK THE OLD UI.
 Worst hitboxes in a patch ive ever seen and Ive been playing almost since release... New animations are janky and oftentimes bug-out getting you killed...

Absolutely 100% pass on this game if you're new until they've patched everything they've destroyed this patch or you're gonna have an awful time.

Right now, I'm actually refreshing the page every hour or so to check if the new killer (the one from Saw movies) is in. Any time now... ;) But yeah, if you're on the fence, unsure whether to buy it... do it. Just do it! ;) Feed your inner serial killer.
Since the devs bought the rights from the publisher the game has improved a lot. Plenty of balance changes and bug fixes for both sides.

If you want a game that will spoke you at night with your lights off this is the game. Being scared deathless by the killers (other players) or even by other survivors who may bring the killer to you now and again.

Great game i enjoy it on my PC and Switch initially i suppose i gave a bad review before cause i was not so good at looping the killer but i got better and they fixed freddy cause he was my all time reason to want to quit a game. Great new content has been added over the years and fun perks to play with from both killer and survivor. Although i am a survivor main i do play killer from time to time just to mix it up. Sometimes you have to deal with toxic killers and survivors from time to time. But overall the devs did a pretty good job so far. This is one of my favorite games to play but lets be real it can be stressful. 8/10

Dead By Daylight has an awesome concept where its 4v1 Asymmetrical Horror/Chase where you either down the Survivors as a " Killer " or Escape from the Killer as a  " Survivor "   The game at its base is a lot of fun and is very entertaining when playing Survivor, especially with Friends. It is important to note, that Killer gameplay varies greatly and can be very challenging, even fustrating at times.

It's a pretty good game. I like the variety of killers and the concept of it. Each match is different depending on the skill of the players, teammates, or the killer. It's really enjoyable and I'm going to be playing it for a long time.

TL;DR:  Game is fun, but has moments when you are most decidedly not having fun. Ratio of fun vs not fun varies depending on experience, temperament of yourself and those around you, level of intoxication, and number of f*cks given.

Ok. So you're a beginner looking to pick up this game. As a survivor, I'll tell you right now, you're going to hate it at first. There's no tutorial, and it's kind of like a rogue lite in the sense that it's nearly impossible to accomplish anything when you first start out. But, even though you die over and over again, you still earn bloodpoints that you can spend on items and perks to make yourself just a little bit stronger. Pretty soon you'll start actually escaping, or at least earn enough points to not de-rank. You can watch all the youtube videos you want, but to get better at DbD, you're just going to have to play.

I have no idea what to expect at the higher tiers of gameplay, or if I'll even get there at this point, but so far I'm firmly in a love-hate relationship with this game.

I am astounded by how much support this game gets from the developer.  Some people will complain that bugs exists or that imbalances exists......NOT MANY DEVELOPERS PUT THE TIME THAT BEHAVIOR DOES.  They've updated the games content well over 3 years now and doesn't seem to slow down.  The new archives and rifts are welcome motivations for old/new players alike.  We are still getting new maps, new survivors, new killers, new perks, and new cosmetics that can be earned via gameplay.  Sometimes bugs show up (appropriate frequency for the amount of updates), sometimes events get delayed (rare).  This is a horror fans dream, and should be experienced by all!
i love this game, i cant wait for the next DLC to drop
